definition: tree/wood/coffin/wooden/simple/numb/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: So the good spirit collected wood every night.
sentences.chinese: 于是这位善良的神仙每天晚上收集木柴。

sentences.english: We settled in, getting the wood stove going and then propping our boots around it to dry.
sentences.chinese: 我们安顿下来，生起木柴炉，把靴子放在炉边烤干。

sentences.english: The billet fell as he spoke, and he threw it into a basket.
sentences.chinese: 他说着话，木柴掉了下来，他把它扔到篮子里。

sentences.english: An Afghan worker cuts firewood to light a brick kiln in Kabul.
sentences.chinese: 在喀布尔，一阿富汗工人削木柴，以点燃砖窑。

sentences.english: He sawed the tree up for firewood.
sentences.chinese: 他把那棵树锯成一小块一小块的木柴。

sentences.english: Have we enough firewood in for the coming week?
sentences.chinese: 下星期用的木柴我们已备足了吗？

sentences.english: They took the young men to grind, and the children fell under the wood.
sentences.chinese: 少年人扛磨石，孩童背木柴，都绊跌了。

sentences.english: I stopped at the woodshed and picked several sticks of wood.
sentences.chinese: 我到柴火间里取了些木柴。

sentences.english: 'So Abraham took the wood for the sacrifice and laid it on his son Isaac's shoulder;
sentences.chinese: 亚伯拉罕拿着祭祀用的木柴，反它放在儿子以撒户上。

sentences.english: He persevered with his task until he had succeeded in collecting an armful of firewood.
sentences.chinese: 他坚守着他的目标，直到成功收集了一抱木柴。

sentences.english: The log has slivered into kindling.
sentences.chinese: 那块木头已劈成了木柴。

sentences.english: Chop some wood for the fire.
He ignited the wood with a band of hay.
sentences.chinese: 他用一把干草引燃了这些木柴。

sentences.english: This wood is too wet to kindle.
The tobacco leaves are cured in wood smoke.
sentences.chinese: 烟叶是用木柴的烟熏烤加工而成的。

sentences.english: Pappy, sitting on a nearby log, was deep in thought.
sentences.chinese: 帕皮坐在旁边的木柴上，陷入了沉思。

definition: to light a fire for cooking
to make a fire/to light a fire
